alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Indian River; Martin; Northern Brevard County; Southern Brevard County; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 06 at 4:19AM EST until March 07 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Breezy Southeast winds will produce rough surf and a strong northward flowing longshore current. A Moderate risk of life threatening rip currents will also exist. * WHERE...Volusia, Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie and Martin Counties. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Strong currents and breaking waves can knock you off your feet and make you even more susceptible to being caught in the seaward pull of a rip current. Entering the surf today is discouraged.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Indian River; Martin; Northern Brevard County; Southern Brevard County; St. Lucie
